intro: Senecio brachycephalus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features a short, upright stem with narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its showy yellow flowers are surrounded by white ray florets, creating a daisy-like appearance. Senecio brachycephalus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
